problem_text: In Fig. 23-56, a nonconducting spherical shell of inner radius $a=2.00 \mathrm{~cm}$ and outer radius $b=2.40 \mathrm{~cm}$ has (within its thickness) a positive volume charge density $\rho=A / r$, where $A$ is a constant and $r$ is the distance from the center of the shell. In addition, a small ball of charge $q=45.0 \mathrm{fC}$ is located at that center. What value should $A$ have if the electric field in the shell $(a \leq r \leq$ $b)$ is to be uniform?
